intro: Teucrium helianthemoides, commonly known as rock rose or wild thyme, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a low-growing perennial shrub with aromatic, gray-green leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, showy flowers in shades of pink, purple, or white, typically blooming from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy plant suitable for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Teucrium helianthemoides is also valued for its medicinal properties and historical use in traditional herbal remedies.
